Hi Mostapha,
Thank you for this post, We all proud of you.
For one educational project, I am trying to evaluate the effect of thick water wall on daylight distribution inside a room. (as you know it is not possible with glass material) this water wall is oriented to the south with thickness about 25 cm. I have defined a dielectric material in radiance for Water as this: void dielectric Water 0 0 5 0.8695 0.8695 0.8695 1.33 0 #red_transmissivity  green_transmissivity   blue_transmissivity   index_of_refraction   0 Therefore, I defined 2 surfaces for front and back and since there is just one layer of dielectric, I don't need using any interface material. But the direction of these surface is very tricky. both directions have to be toward outside (?) should I rotate them inside in reverse ray tracing???  The resultant values are significantly different. any comments would be really helpful for me. 
thanks in advance.
